intro: Hellenia meghalayensis, commonly known as the Meghalaya hellenia, is a rare flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as hill forests and rocky crevices. Its botanical features include a slender stem, aromatic foliage, and white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for ecological and botanical studies.
